bio:treatment.discussion: Asplenium × curtissii , sterile and with irregular meiosis, is the product of hybridization between A . abscissum and A . verecundum and occurs with them in central Florida, sometimes forming large colonies by root proliferation. It can readily be separated from A . abscissum by its pinnate blades. From A . verecundum it can be distinguished by its relatively long petioles and less divided blades. Asplenium × curtissi is known only from several localities in north central Florida. It makes a showy conservatory plant.
